column1: Novodvinsk (Russian: Новодви́нск) is a town in the north of Arkhangelsk Oblast
column3: located on the left bank of the Northern Dvina River
column4: 20 kilometers (12 mi) south of Arkhangelsk. Population: 40

column1: It was founded in 1935 as the settlement of Voroshilovsky (Вороши́ловский) serving a pulp and paper mill. It was granted urban-type settlement status in 1941
column3: and was granted town status in 1977
column4: at which time it also got its present name. Simultaneously
column5: Novodvinsk was removed from Primorsky District of Arkhangelsk Oblast and became the town of oblast significance.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated as the town of oblast significance of Novodvinsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of oblast significance of Novodvinsk is incorporated as Novodvinsk Urban Okrug.

column1: The economy of Novodvinsk is based on the timber industry. The main employer in the town is Arkhangelsk Pulp and Paper Mill (Russian: Архангельский ЦБК). Additionally
column2: there are a concrete construction plant and a plywood factory (which also produces furniture).

column1: The Northern Dvina is navigable in Novodvinsk
column2: and there is some passenger navigation. There is also bus passenger service to Arkhangelsk. There is no passenger rail service.

column4: and two higher education schools associated with Saint-Petersburg Academy of Management and Economics
